Akkan Raid
The Eye of Decay obtained from defeating <FONT COLOR='#669966'>Plague Legion Commander Akkan</FONT> can be used to craft more powerful gear for transfer.
The soul of the torn Demon has resurrected through the power of Akkan.
Akkan and his Plague Legion invaded the kingdom of Aetanople and brought it to utter ruin.
The souls of the deceased still wander the living world, shackled by Akkan's spells.
Akkan has been regaining his strength, absorbing the lost bits of his body.
The life energy Akkan absorbed in Arkesia served as fuel to hasten the Red Moon's coming.
Death loses its meaning before the Akkan's formidable power.
[Common] Plague Legion Commander Akkan
<FONT COLOR='#FF6000'>[Inferno]</FONT> Defeat Plague Legion Commander Akkan
Vrad gladly sacrificed his own people as offerings to Plague Legion Commander Akkan before falling to the Demon himself.
Empowered by the stolen life force of countless sacrifices, Akkan sought out the Ark.
You finally defeated Akkan and obtained the Ark of Hope.
Akkan's mission was accomplished successfully.
You overcame the temptations of the Ruby Eye and fought the Demons trying to resurrect Akkan.
... Master Akkan!
We must find Akkan!
Aaaagh! Master Akkan!
That breath. That life. It now belongs to Akkan, the Lord of Plague!
Akkan was looking for a sealed body.
... the Ruby Eye. Akkan's eye.
The Ruby Eye derives its power from the soul of Akkan, a powerful Demon.
You dare interrupt the resurrection of Master Akkan?!
Prepare yourself for the return of Akkan, Lord of Decay!
Master Akkan... I can feel his presence!
Akkan, the Lord of Decay, shall finally awaken!
There is no place for you among the living, Akkan!
Akkan's essence has been locked away once more.
After Akkan gathered the necessary sacrifices...
Akkan!
It's over, Akkan!
We should go after Akkan immediately.
Bow to Akkan, Lord of Death!
<FONT color='#999999'>Bow to Akkan, Lord of Death!</FONT>
A trophy that celebrates great heroes who protected countless lives from Plague Legion Commander Akkan.
A limited trophy that was made for invincible raid groups who cleared Corrupt Lord's Pandemonium perfectly. "Bow to Akkan, Lord of Death!"
Lord of Degradation Akkan

The Chaos Gates have opened all across the world, and the commanders have all shown themselves.
An even bigger war will now begin.</next>I can no longer feel the energies of Akkan and Thaemine, so I'm heading to the battlefield to help the people there.
Advance to Akkan <FONT color='{0}'>plague crater</FONT>
I have defeated Plague Legion Commander Akkan and have been chosen by the Ark slumbering in Shushire. It is high time to return to Rigens Village Plaza and share the good news with everyone.

* The Visitors
It's getting difficult to find enough prisoners to offer to Akkan. Fie on those Daybreakers! Hypocrites!
They wouldn't exist if it weren't for my arena, and yet they don't stop complaining.
Today, some arrogant Demons came by.
One of them was as pretty as a girl and acted as if he were a prince. The other one had white hair and a sad look in his eyes for some reason. I don't understand why Ruave cowers before them -- they look like they wouldn't last even a minute in my arena.

* The Wild Dog
He used to be an obedient dog, but not anymore.
Instead of catching the Daybreakers as ordered, he's been scheming behind my back.
He's been traveling from island to island, picking up various products, probably to take over my position, but he's only wasting his time and money. I'm going to teach him what happens to a dog that bites the hand that feeds him. When my current work is finished, I'll make sure there's no place for him in Shushire.
With Plague Legion Commander Akkan gone, a new dawn begins for Shushire.
I am passing through Frostpeak Temple. Shandi says Akkan is looking for the Ark on Icewing Heights, so I must ride Graymoon Dietrich's tamed frost wolf to the Graymoon Camp.

I'm glad you're safe.
I've recovered, thanks to you.</next>The commander of the Plague Legion is named Akkan.</next>I don't know what he wants,
but I'm not going to let his Demons run amok in Shushire.</next>An advance party has left for the Icewing Heights.
Please go help them stop Akkan.</next>I'll follow you soon, with the other members.</next>See you there.

The traitorous priest of Sirius, Nakshun, has weakened the Ward of Frost. Convinced that the relic called "The Promise of God" in Frostpeak Temple is Shushire's Ark, he is trying to seize the relic for his master, Akkan. I must follow him to Frostpeak Temple to stop him.

Heh-heh-heh... Sirius's loyal watchdogs,
I confer a blessing on <FONT COLOR='#D4FF88'>Akkan</FONT>'s behalf.
Enjoy the gift of perpetual pestilence!
The Graymoons chasing Akkan set up a temporary camp on the Icewing Heights and were scouting the area. I set out to meet with Father Bowen in their temporary base to assess the situation.
Protect the <FONT COLOR='{0}'>Ark</FONT> from Akkan in the Maze of Mirrors
Akkan has headed for the Maze of Mirrors to get the Ark. I am following, in hopes of stopping him before he finds it.

Ah, I've been waiting.</next>This is the entrance to the Maze of Mirrors, the place you've been looking for.</next>Akkan must also be looking for
the Ark that lies dormant here.</next>You're little bit late, and this maze is not as easy to navigate as you'd think.</next>Once a place for communing with the gods,
it's now an excellent fortress for the Ark.</next>I have faith in you. Reach the Ark before Akkan.</next>What are you waiting for? Go, already!
Commander Akkan
Follow <FONT COLOR='{0}'>Akkan</FONT>
Defeat <FONT COLOR='{0}'>Akkan</FONT>
Shushire's Ark lies dormant in the Maze of Mirrors. I should explore the place in a bid to protect the Ark against Akkan.

Making Balthorr's <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Mysterious Stone</FONT>

Put in some <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Sidereal Energy</FONT> as essence!
And an <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Eye of Decay</FONT> that can be obtained by defeating Akkan!
And lots of <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Romantic Ingredient Kits</FONT>! Lots!

When all these are combined and delicately processed by an artisan,
they are reborn as <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Mysterious Stones</FONT> full of ancient power.
And if you imbue this <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Mysterious Stone</FONT> onto a Sidereal Weapon?

 A more powerful Sidereal Weapon that is truly <FONT color="#FF503E">r</FONT><FONT color="#FE9600">o</FONT><FONT color="#FFD200">m</FONT><FONT color='#D4FF88'>a</FONT><FONT color="#A2CCF6">n</FONT><FONT color="#BF9EF6">tic</FONT> <FONT color='#D4FF88'>will be yours</FONT>.

The energy of the <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Plague Legion Commander</FONT> can be felt strongly in this land.</next>It seems <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Akkan's</FONT> power resurrected Valtan.</next>As it is, Luterra will be in danger.
Use the <FONT color='{0}'>Magick Tracker</FONT> to search for signs of Akkan
<FONT color='#D4FF88'>Akkan</FONT>?

The flesh of Akkan is heading toward Arthetine. I must warn Bastian of the Plague Legion's attack.

<FONT color='#FF503E'>The Rapport Action menu for Bastian will be inaccessible during certain stages of this quest.</FONT>

<FONT color='#FFFFAC'><$PCname/></FONT>, I've been waiting for you.</next>It's unfortunate we don't have time to catch up over some tea.</next>I received a message from the queen of Vern.
She warned me that the <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Plague Legion Commander</FONT> might soon attack.</next>I also received the data analysis sent by the Magick Society of Vern.</next>To think that they traced the location of a Demon through Magick Streams.
It's an extremely interesting development!
We were having difficulties just analyzing the basic isotopes but this will be of huge help.</next>I passed the data along to the Regulator Intelligence Agency.
With their help, we should be able to step up our search for the Plague Legion.</next><FONT color='#D4FF88'>Akkan</FONT>...
The bad blood between the Cykin and that particular Demon goes way back.</next>A lot of problems arose in Arthetine because part of his body was sealed.</next>The Ruby Eye bewitched professor <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Bergstrom</FONT>, driving him to kidnap civilians and perform experiments on them.</next>Demons of the Plague Legion invaded the Temple of Sceptrum,
where the <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Ruby Eye</FONT> was sealed.

After that tragedy, we felt that we needed to investigate the Plague Legion more thoroughly.</next>That's why the Regulators formed a joint investigation team with the Priests of Sceptrum to study the various demonic traces they left behind.</next>The team sought to analyze the plague energy, not just in Arthetine but in all of Arkesia.</next>Thankfully, their efforts have paid off. The Regulators are currently tracking down
the Plague Legion based on the data.</next>The current investigation is closely related to <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Akkan</FONT>, so it will be a very dangerous endeavor.</next>There is no one more fit for the next phase of the job than you.
After all, you've saved Arkesia several times already!</next>Inspector, will you participate in the investigation of the Plague Legion?

Inspector, nice to meet you. I am Heiligen, humble servant of Sceptrum.</next>The Regulators have been searching all of Arthetine.
Their administrator probably sensed the same danger we did.</next><FONT color='#D4FF88'>Akkan</FONT>. I can feel his presence.
It's faint, but his stinking malice permeates the air.</next>Because of the Plague Legion, we lost a lot of brothers.
How could I forget that atrocity?</next>Our chapter knew there would always be a chance for us to be attacked
as long as we had Akkan's body sealed in the temple.</next>That's why we've cooperated with the Regulators to search for the remnants of
the Plague Legion all across Arkesia.</next>This report consists of the fruit of those perilous investigations.
Please read it.

Akkan's research data pointed to the remote village of Totrich, which was ruled by the Nightmare of Decay long ago. Bastian wanted to send a Regulator to strengthen Totrich's defenses and continue the investigation.

In the end... we were right.</next>That one day they'll return to find the body of Akkan...</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Heiligen closes his eyes and prays briefly...)</FONT></next>It is said that Sidereal Sien visited the temple after the Chain War ended.</next>Sidereal Sien entrusted the priests with the eyes, horns, and heart of Akkan.
We pledged that he would never be resurrected in this barren, uninhabitable land.</next>The Temple of Sceptrum has faithfully guarded the demon's body for hundreds of years.</next>The desert climate prevented it from being able to absorb life force, but...</next>As Sidereal Sien warned... 
Demons do not give up so easily. </next>I will lead the priests to the temple first.</next>We plan to further strengthen the barriers with the priests so Akkan's power does not leak out.</next>We are not afraid. Even if Akkan appears in front of us...</next>The shining wisdom of the goddess will blind our eyes to the horror.</next>Inspector, please take care of the people of the nearby village.</next>We will contact you immediately if we see any strange signs.</next>May the wisdom of Sceptrum be with you.
It might be related to Akkan.
For Akkan, <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Wei</FONT>'s ability will be better than mine.
I'm investigating Akkan.

Hmm... </next>That Demon's power is sealed in the Temple of Sceptrum beyond the wilderness.</next>When I was younger, I always thought that story had more of a ring of legend than truth.</next>However, when Dr. Bergstrom obtained Akkan's eyes...</next>I saw firsthand... just how real the power of Demons were. How easily it could... destroy a person.</next>Fortunately, the priests of Sceptrum are keeping those Demonic artifacts locked away for good.</next>They've done such a good job keeping the evil presence contained, all the young people who have settled in this little village think it's all a rumor.</next>Just like me when I was young. Hahaha...</next>It's strange how life has flourished out here in this edge of nowhere.</next>This town is a bit like the beauty of a <FONT color='#D4FF88'>flowering cactus in a barren desert..</FONT></next>This really is a special place. I hope nothing happens to it.</next>Well, you are here, so of course nothing will happen.</next>Please take care of our village. And take care of our youngins too!

I'll find the real y'all soon and--Huh?</next>I-Inspector. What brings you here?</next>Oh, you came to investigate Akkan.</next>I am Narhert, the former captain of the militia.</next>I hope you are not here because of a problem?

Oh, so not an emergency then. That's good.</next>The militia has been oh high alert for a while now.
So many reinforcements sent from the Regulators here to investigate Akkan.</next>Between getting them all up to speed and chasing down any and all leads, we've just been so busy.</next>I haven't slept in the last few days, and today is my day off.</next>And of course that's when those kids show up with their pranks!</next>They always come and cause a ruckus when I get to finally sleep!

Oh, I thought the villagers would be worried if they heard from the inside...</next>Here's the report.</next>A thorough search was conducted around Totrich, but there were no signs of any plague.</next>The villagers still appear to be healthy and showing no signs of ailment.</next>We still don't know when or how the power of Akkan will manifest.
So right now we're basically on the lookout for any strange happening or incident, no matter how minor.</next>But...</next>Are we sure that Akkan's... flesh is moving here?</next>What's so special about our little town?</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Brant glances at the antique shop.)</FONT>

Totrich is in the process of purifying... We lost our peaceful village in an instant.</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Bastian is speechless for a moment...)</FONT></next>Still, with your help... the worst was prevented. Thank you.</next>The tech department has pinpointed where <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Akkan</FONT> is headed.</next>Shortly after the incident, there was a huge energy drain in the small city-state of Rethramis.</next>The same thing happened to Totrich, so there is a high possibility that Akkan will appear there.</next>Wherever's happening...
We have to stop what happened in Totrich from repeating itself.</next><FONT color='#FFFFAC'><$PCname/></FONT>, we will need your help once again.
From here on, Arthetine will do everything in its power to help.</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(You sense a familiar presence behind you...)</FONT></next>... You made it! Master Shandi...

Oh. You're here too. Excellent.</next>I hear we're dealing with Plague Demons.
I'll have to show everyone what you saw.</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Shandi lifts his rod into the air and swings it around dramatically...)</FONT></next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Illusions begin to appear in the air of... your memories?)</FONT></next>So Akkan has recovered his body.
Is that true?</next>That damn Demon... 
He's trying to turn this world into hell!

Akkan is a monster, through and through...
He's died and returned more times than I can count.</next>And the orrendous plagues he creates are equally hard to eradicate.</next>I remember... no...
It is best to stay unstained, purify and seize the opportunity.</next><FONT color='#D4FF88'>Inanna</FONT> will be of more help than me.</next>Survive with your persistent vitality.

<FONT color='#FFFFAC'><$PCname/></FONT>...</next>The same thing happened during the Chain Wars.</next>Akkan poisoned not only the bodies but the very souls of people with the power of a highly contagious disease.</next>Little by little they ran out of breath as if suffocating alive...
Until they stopped breathing altogether. Drowned on nothing but air.</next>Watching my friends decay and die around me and being powerless to help them...</next>I'll go with you all. 
I vow that painful and difficult disease will claim no more innocent victims...</next>This time, for sure, we will put an end to it!

The place where the water surface has risen is <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Aetanople</FONT>.</next>It's on the outskirts of Rethramis and during a flood, waters there flow into Rethramis and even Luterra.</next>I suspect they may have been looking for such a place on purpose to allow the plague to spread quickly.</next>I will inform the neighboring countries of Aetanople that they should
evacuate civilians in the path and prepare for flooding.</next>Also...
I intend to accompany you on your way to Aetanople.</next>There are accounts of previous kings subduing Akkan with the Vanquisher.
If those tales are accurate, I might be able to help too.</next>But even with Vanquisher, we're going to need you <FONT color='#FFFFAC'><$PCname/></FONT>.

Akkan... He regained his body.</next>After the Chain War, <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Sien</FONT> opened the Sihwa School and taught his disciples
everything he knew about defeating the Demons.</next>He spoke a lot about Akkan in particular.</next>He said to always be vigilant as that Demon would never give up trying to recover its body.</next>During the Chain War, Sien fought alone against Akkan.
He defeated Akkan by smashing his horns and ripping out his eyes and heart.</next>But even with all that, he had to force <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Dochul</FONT> to swallow Akkan's weakened body.</next>There was no other way to prevent the resurrection of Akkan...</next>The rest of Akkan's body was given to the priests...
My old master Sai said that <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Dochul</FONT> is a being that originates from the void.
It cannot be harmed here in Arkesia.</next>I will do my best so that the power inherited from my master can be helpful to everyone.</next>That is my duty as the successor of Sien and the <FONT color='#D4FF88'>current leader of the Sihwa School</FONT>.

I have one last thing to tell you.</next>Akkan's eyes see death beyond fear.</next>Even if you are infected with the plague, if death does not come, you must endure it somehow.</next>Your mind will play tricks on you. Even if the Demon appears weak...</next>If you can overcome the agony, it may be possible for you to regain your grasp on reality.</next>Remember. The end of a terrible disease is never death.</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Shandi gestures into the air, and the illusions of the Sidereal wave and disappear...)</FONT></next>The Destined Star has never left you,
trust your allies.

▶ Victim count: 2506. Still searching for survivors 
▶ Confirmed that Akkan's plague is transmitted not only to Humans but also the very earth itself.
▶ Identified invisible plague tumors (sample collection complete) 
▶ Pollution level in Aetanople increased due to plague rain.
Cleanup work in progress
▶ After <FONT color='#FFFFAC'><$PCname/></FONT> defeated Akkan, it was confirmed that the spread of the disease halted.

▶ Special Note
: The bodies and souls of people were being infused into the gigantic sphere.
: The <FONT color='#D4FF88'>huge red sphere</FONT> disappeared into the cracked darkness.

... So...</next>You are back... </next>... Is <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Akkan</FONT>... dead?</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Rubich looks up with a desperate face...)</FONT></next>We... couldn't find anyone's body in one piece...
It's all corrupt... and mangled...</next>I... survived...</next>I will curse that Demon for the rest of my life...</next>For taking the spark of life out of this barren land... Look at the village... Sometimes... The survivors...</next>Live in a more desperate hell...

What happened in the Rethramis Federation... </next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Sasha is unable to speak for a while.)</FONT></next>I knew Akkan would appear there, but we were too late...
In the end, we couldn't prevent the great tragedy. </next>I'm trying to work with Rethramis to search for any survivors.

All of the life force Akkan had gathered flowed into the huge <FONT color='#D4FF88'>red sphere</FONT>.</next>The Tech Branch suggested several hypothetical purposes for this.</next>But among them, the most reasonably consistent with past records... was the <FONT color='#D4FF88'>moon</FONT>.

As you can see, we are still trying to fix the situation in Totrich.</next>Reconstructing of buildings was the easy part.
The broken hearts of those who have lost their families will not be so easily healed.</next>No matter how painful things are... the survivors have to keep going. Keep living.</next>I need a break. I'm about to fall over.</next>Can you take a look at this? This is a report based on the data collected during the war against Akkan.
An urgent report has come in that Akkan's minions have appeared in the Temple of Sceptrum. In the plague-covered temple, the Priests of Sceptrum risk their lives to stop Akkan.

...</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(Heiligen seems to be running out of life...)</FONT></next>... Please... forgive me...</next>It looks like... I didn't... have the skills... to cover the eyes with wisdom...</next>What that Demon wants... is life...</next>Where... Akkan passes... there are only corpses... The village...</next>Is in danger... Please, hurry.!</next>... *Cough*...</next><FONT color="#FFFFAC">(He ceases to move after that last cough...)</FONT>

The village was destroyed in an instant...</next>Akkan... </next>... Has regained its powers.</next>I came here after receiving a report about a huge energy wave.</next>Akkan is moving at a speed we can't even imagine, absorbing vitality from people
to replenish its depleted energy.

The rest of the repairs will be handled by the people who came with me.
You must come to the <FONT color='#D4FF88'>Hall of Transcendence</FONT> with me.</next>I have something to tell you about Akkan's whereabouts.

If one were to name the most horrifying enemies in the long years of the Chain War,
one would, without a doubt, name the commanders of the Legion of Kazeros.

Valtan, Commander of the Demon Beast Legion, was a manifestation of the word "power" itself. Before he was defeated by Sidereal Luterra, he and his legion slaughtered an incalculable number of knights.

Plague Legion Commander Akkan was a highly cunning fiend, who never fought in the front line. Akkan used his soldiers and debilitating sickness to attack strongholds and enjoyed the slow deaths he inflicted upon the defending forces.
He was truly atrocious.

Kakul-Saydon was the commander of the Mayhem Legion--the one to blame for all the trouble infecting this land. Rather than fielding his troops in battle, he held a feast that turned out to be a demonic trap. It made our soldiers lose themselves, and they started killing each other.

Vykas led the Covetous Legion, and she had the power to bring out the worst of Human nature. Those who surrendered to her lost their reason to the point that they staged a rebellion against their own people.

Brelshaza was the commander of the Phantom Legion and was the most cool and calculating of the Evil Legion Commanders. She was also a master of demonic sorcery. Brelshaza's evil schemes sowed seeds of distrust among the kings of Arkesia.

There are no records or information about the Darkness Legion Commander.
Plague Legion Commander Akkan

The wind blowing from afar is carrying chaos.</next>Vykas... Akkan...? I'm not sure...
But I need to find out before someone gets hurt!

I'm really strong... I can shoot all the way beyond the sea.
Hit Kakul-Saydon with one try, and hit Akkan's eye.</next>So, you don't need to worry.
I will destroy everything with Perkunas.</next>And... I don't want you to get hurt.
...</next>Let's head back to the <FONT color='#D4FF88'>island</FONT> before it gets dark!

We've found traces of the Ark. Soldiers of the Plague Legion,
follow them down to hell!
Take the Ark for Akkan!
Defeat <FONT color='{0}'>Akkan</FONT> in the Eroded Prison
Destroy <FONT color='{0}'>Akkan</FONT> in the Execution Ground
Akkan Emoticon #3 Type the phrase [DecayingWatch] to trigger the emoticon. "Death is waiting for you!"
Akkan Emoticon #1 Type the phrase [DecayingDespair] to trigger the emoticon. "You will be destroyed in utter despair!"
Akkan Emoticon #2 Type the phrase [DecayingThumbsUp] to trigger the emoticon. "Welcome the eternal night!"
Akkan Emoticon #5 Type the phrase [ThankYouFortheFood] to trigger the emoticon. "Behold the power of corruption!"
Akkan Emoticon #4 Type the phrase [DecayingHunt] to trigger the emoticon. "Prisoners of the Light! Hiding is futile!"
Akkan Emoticon #6 Type the phrase [Can'tUnseeIt] to trigger the emoticon. "I saw something I shouldn't have because of you!"
Akkan Emoticon #7 Type the phrase [Can'tUnseeItKuri] to trigger the emoticon. "I can't unsee it."
Akkan Emoticon #8 Type the phrase [Can'tUnseeItGold] to trigger the emoticon. "I can't unsee it."
Akkan Emoticon #9 Type the phrase [Can'tUnseeItSilver] to trigger the emoticon. "I can't unsee it."

You must use <FONT COLOR='#d4ff88'>Akkan's Eye</font> to see the Demons.
Show yourself, Dochul!
A Demon serving Akkan, the commander of the Plague Legion. He seeks the Ark to make Akkan's body complete again.
A member of the Plague Legion charged with delivering Shushire prisoners to Akkan.
A trophy that celebrates great heroes who protected countless lives from Plague Legion Commander Akkan.
A limited trophy awarded to invincible raid groups who cleared Corrupt Lord's Pandemonium perfectly. "Bow to Akkan, Lord of Death!"

Special capsule made by the Magick Society that summons Uncontrollable Akkan.

Use to add this pet to your <FONT COLOR='#FFFFAC'>Pet Inventory</FONT>.

Special capsule made by the Magick Society that summons Scamp Akkan.

Use to add this pet to your <FONT COLOR='#FFFFAC'>Pet Inventory</FONT>.

Special capsule made by the Magick Society that summons Hazy Akkan.

Use to add this pet to your <FONT COLOR='#FFFFAC'>Pet Inventory</FONT>.
A Tier 1 reward chest that contains the energy of Plague Legion Commander Akkan.
A Tier 2 reward chest that contains the energy of Plague Legion Commander Akkan.
A Tier 3 reward chest that contains the energy of Plague Legion Commander Akkan.
A Tier 4 reward chest that contains the energy of Plague Legion Commander Akkan.
A Demon serving Akkan, the commander of the Plague Legion. He's after the Ark to make Akkan's body complete again.

A seal that symbolizes beastly strength. "Valtan's soul was healed by Akkan and is beginning to recover his memories over time." Valtan [Inferno] Mode First-time Cleared Reward Can be exchanged for Reward Chests through the Legion Raid Seal Merchant.

A seal that generates noxious, disease-ridden energy. "Akkan's flesh, now scattered across Arkesia, is eating away at the land, absorbing its vital forces." Akkan [Inferno] Mode First-time Cleared Reward Can be exchanged for Reward Chests through the Legion Raid Seal Merchant.

A reward chest only allotted to those who have overcome the debilitating pain of disease. An aura of pain and ruin emanates from it.
